Sentencas: Regarding the ability of solid oxide fuel cell-based energy conversion systems and modifying their design structure, the current study comprehensively investigates the potential of empowering a novel integrated solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant via liquefied natural gas together with geothermal energy, addressing this matter.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: Likewise, the newly designed system embraces an efficient design through multi-heat recovery based on two energy sources.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: In this regard, the sensitivity analysis and optimization (using a genetic algorithm) methods are utilized to assess the proposed system, taking into account the energy, exergy, exergo-economic, and environmental perspectives.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: The results indicate that as the current density of the cell increases, the net output power and energy efficiency of the system enhance.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: Among considered decision variables, geothermal water temperature and turbine pressure have the severest impacts on the output power and the corresponding unit cost.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: Moreover, optimization results reveal that the air heat exchanger and turbine have the highest exergy destruction costs with values of 4800 $/year and 4500 $/year, respectively.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant

Sentencas: Furthermore, it is found that the emissions' cost (0.000154 $/s) would be around 2% lower when the system is optimized by minimizing unit product cost rather than maximizing the energy or exergy efficiency of the system.
Titulo: Multi-objective optimization of a dual energy-driven solid oxide fuel cell-based power plant
